授業目的:
International accounting is an extremely broad topic. At a minimum, it focuses on the accounting issues unique to multinational corporations, especially with respect to foreign operations. At the other extreme it encompasses the study of the various functional areas of accounting in all countries of the world, as well as the activities of a number of supranational organizations.
The course is divided into two parts: During the first part, I review basics of accounting, using the same textbook that I used for the “Introduction to Financial Accounting” course. The goal for the second part is to provide students with an overview of the broadly defined area of international accounting, with a focus on the accounting issues encountered by multinational companies engaged in international trade and invested in foreign operations.
到達目標: In this course, you will learn the important concepts underlying financial statements, the accounting principles, and some tools to analyze firms’ financial reporting. The goal for this course is to equip you with sufficient understanding of the concepts, methods, and uses of financial information so that you can practically use financial data of firms and make decisions about economic activities.  Also, specific topics related to international accounting, introduced in this course are: diversity in accounting, international convergence of financial reporting, and comparative international auditing and corporate governance.
